articles.author: Ken Alltucker
articles.title: 40% of cancers found to be preventable with these lifestyle changes - USA TODAY
articles.description: An American Cancer Society study says 40% of cancer in adults 30 and over can be avoided if people cut out smoking, drinking and other risks.
articles.content:
There's new evidence of the health benefits of avoiding smoking, excessive drinking and being dangerously overweight: they are the leading preventable causes of cancer in adults, a new study found.
